pull_request.title: Allow to charge a cancellation fee on unpaid orders
pull_request.body:
This PR adds the option to charge a cancellation fee on unpaid orders. It also changes the restriction of "cancellation fee must not be higher than sum of payments minus refunds" to "cancellation fee must not be higher than order total"

It does *not* implement cancellation requests or adjustable cancellation fees for unpaid orders, as I don't think these are relevant use cases.

This PR also adds one intentional regression: It removes any option for self-service cancellation for *partially paid* orders, because with the new options it becomes absolutely confusing of which rules should apply and there would be a ton of really weird edge-case situations. This might be a problem for some customers who use upgrade functionality maybe? Not sure if we can afford the regression, but I really don't want to deal with all those edge cases.

commits.message: Fix form validation of cancellation form

pull_request.title: Clarify order of add-ons in cart
pull_request.body:
A customer complained that by going back and forth in the checkout process and changing the number of add-on products, you can create very weird groupings in the cart such as this:

![image006](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64280/194512471-365670f9-785b-4bdc-887f-b0265d05a8bf.png)

This PR makes the cart view completely ignore "chronological" order and strictly sort by the sorting attributes of the products and variations involved, with one exception: Bundled products are always sorted before add-on products.

The same sorting is applied when submitting the order and computing the ``positionid`` attributes to avoid bad grouping and sorting in the order later on.

There's one downside to all this, which is that the ``position`` attribute of ``ItemAddOn`` is now completely ignored in the cart, only the ``position`` attribute of the ``ItemCategory`` itself is respected. The order of ``ItemAddOn``s is only relevant for the display in the add-on step it self now. People will complain about this as well, but I think it's a fair trade-off.

:microscope: Output optimization

    • #14952 [ts] remove nested declare namespace (@​liuxingbaoyu)

  • Huáng Jùnliàng (@​JLHwung)

pull_request.title: bump css-inline from 0.7.x to 0.8.x to allow for successful arm64 installs.
pull_request.body:
This fixes the issues encountered in #2681 in which currently an install of pretix fails on arm64 systems as wheels for arm64 weren't added until this [commit](https://github.com/Stranger6667/css-inline/commit/559e43aaf3787d8bc0d460ed30cc5dbb2935b2bd). 

Currently, it falls back to wanting to compile `css-inline` with rust, however certain compiler options aren't passed in order to get a functioning `css-inline`. Thankfully with `0.8.0` and on, a properly compiled package is available for arm64.

issue.title: bump css-inline from 0.7.x to 0.8.x to allow for successful arm64 installs.
issue.body:
This fixes the issues encountered in #2681 in which currently an install of pretix fails on arm64 systems as wheels for arm64 weren't added until this [commit](https://github.com/Stranger6667/css-inline/commit/559e43aaf3787d8bc0d460ed30cc5dbb2935b2bd). 

Currently, it falls back to wanting to compile `css-inline` with rust, however certain compiler options aren't passed in order to get a functioning `css-inline`. Thankfully with `0.8.0` and on, a properly compiled package is available for arm64.

pull_request.title: PDF/Badges: Improve performance/reduce filesize when creating multiple badges
pull_request.body: Depending on the background-PDF, handling background-PDFs when creating badges could be slow due to PyPDF handling the merging and creating larger filesizes as necessary. This PR splits creating the badge PDF and imposing multiple badges on one page for printing into two separate steps. That way one can use the `render_background` method of the renderer, which by default supports merging backgrounds with pdftk, which is faster and sometimes creates way smaller files (in my tests 3.5MB instead of 13MB).

pull_request.title: API: New implementation for cart creation
pull_request.body:
This PR bundles two changes, in two separate commits:

1. A complete re-implementation of the API endpoint to create carts. Previously, we had an implementation that created a single cart position, and for the bulk endpoint we'd call this implementation in a loop. This was highly inefficient and presented a major blocker for #2408 which basically requires having only one quota check per transaction. The new implementation is a clean implementation of bulk-creation and the single creation now just calls the bulk creation with just one item.
2. Support for atomically creating add-on and bundled positions when creating cart positions.

pull_request.title: Cart: change icon from checkbox to arrow-right for voucher submit
pull_request.body:
As user reports suggest the checkbox icon is not ideal for the submit button when adding a voucher from within the cart. The clearest way would be to use a readable text-label as well, but this could be problematic too as in viewport-width around 480px depending on the length of the translation of „redeem“, the actual voucher input can get quite small so the voucher code in the input will be cut off. Even with just the icon on the button, at 480px viewport-width the voucher code can be cut-off (at least in my tests the last letter was cut off).

Just the word „redeem“:
![Bildschirmfoto 2022-10-04 um 10 46 44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/276509/193777491-61a9ed45-acf1-4f68-818a-b11c1583fde5.png)

Or just a pointer (this is what this PR currently implements):
![Bildschirmfoto 2022-10-04 um 10 48 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/276509/193777511-60c3040c-2dbe-4ebf-a458-8ed454fa4d6d.png)

issue.title: Add Bluetooth support for Brother label printers (QL series)
issue.body:
Currently, the app supports the use of Brother label printers (QL series), connected via LAN/WLAN or USB. The Brother QL-820NWB and QL-1100NWB, however, also support printing via Bluetooth, the use of which for these printers is not yet supported by the pretixPRINT Android app.

Adding Bluetooth support for these printers to the pretixPRINT app would be interesting to us for the following reasons:

- The Brother QL-820NWB can optionally be equipped with a battery pack, providing large flexibility for where it can be used. It can thus be used in a very mobile way, as no power socket is required.
- Printing via Bluetooth does not require the presence of and access to a WIFI network (as connecting via WLAN does). This is thus very convenient when organising events at a location which you do not own yourself, but for instance rent for an evening. No network configuration is thus necessary. The mobile phone running the pretixSCAN app can connect to WIFI (if present) or 3G/4G/5G, while for printing, only a one-off Bluetooth pairing with the printer is necessary.
- These Brother label printers, offer the DK-11234 60mm x 86mm name badge media format, which would be very interesting to use as badges in combination with pretix.

comment.body: I'm pretty sure we decided deliberately against the brother sdk back when we introduced brother support (and I don't think we want two brother implementations) but I don't remember why, maybe @robbi5 does

commits.message: Data update

issue.title: 403 Forbidden error for presale-CSS file in docker installation
issue.body:
Thanks for your awesome work!

I'm trying to get pretix running in docker, following the setup instructions at https://docs.pretix.eu/en/latest/admin/installation/docker_smallscale.html. I use a freshly set up, empty mysql container as database. Afterwards I can call the pretix admin interface and create a sample shop. But as soon as I open the shop page, I only see the HTML code, because the request of the CSS file `presale.a37ec5cea5997d87.css` is answered by the server with an 403 (Forbidden) error code.

I have tried everything I could think of in terms of debugging possibilities and have rebuilt the whole setup in several versions on different environments over and over again without success. Since I have the same problem on my local machine there is no proxy which can block something. I also tried to customize the color of the shop to generate custom CSS files without success.

Steps to reproduce:
* Create folders for /data and config-file with appropriate permissions
* Create docker network: `sudo docker network create pretix_network`
* Start database: `sudo docker run --name pretix_mysql --network pretix_network -v /docker/pretix/mysql:/var/lib/mysql -e MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=<PASSWORD> -e MYSQL_DATABASE=pretix -d mysql:latest`
* If necessary, adjust database authentication by executing `alter user 'root'@'%' identified with mysql_native_password by '<PASSWORD>';` in the container in mysql.
* Start pretix: `sudo docker run --name pretix_main --network pretix_network -p 127.0.0.1:5505:80 -v /docker/pretix/main/data:/data -v /docker/pretix/main/etc:/etc/pretix --sysctl net.core.somaxconn=4096 -d pretix/standalone:3.6`
* Set up a shop with sample data.
* Open the shop and get page without CSS.

Used pretix.cfg file:
```
[pretix]
instance_name=Testinstanz
url=http://localhost:5505
currency=EUR
datadir=/data

[database]
backend=mysql
name=pretix
user=root
password=<PASSWORD>
host=pretix_mysql

[mail]
from=<MAIL>
host=<HOST>
user=<USER>
password=<PASSWD>
port=25
tls=on
```

Output from `sudo docker logs pretix_main`
```
Operations to perform:
  Apply all migrations: auth, badges, banktransfer, contenttypes, oauth2_provider, otp_static, otp_totp, paypal, pretixapi, pretixbase, pretixdroid, pretixhelpers, pretixmultidomain, sessions, stripe, ticketoutputpdf
Running migrations:
  Applying contenttypes.0001_initial... OK
  Applying contenttypes.0002_remove_content_type_name... OK
  [...]
  Applying ticketoutputpdf.0006_auto_20181017_0024... OK
  Applying ticketoutputpdf.0007_auto_20181123_1059... OK
2020-02-19 20:29:32,868 CRIT Supervisor is running as root.  Privileges were not dropped because no user is specified in the config file.  If you intend to run as root, you can set user=root in the config file to avoid this message.
2020-02-19 20:29:32,869 WARN No file matches via include "/etc/supervisord-*.conf"
2020-02-19 20:29:32,875 INFO RPC interface 'supervisor' initialized
2020-02-19 20:29:32,875 CRIT Server 'unix_http_server' running without any HTTP authentication checking
2020-02-19 20:29:32,875 INFO supervisord started with pid 13
2020-02-19 20:29:33,878 INFO spawned: 'pretixweb' with pid 16
2020-02-19 20:29:33,882 INFO spawned: 'pretixtask' with pid 17
2020-02-19 20:29:33,883 INFO spawned: 'nginx' with pid 18
2020-02-19 20:29:34,889 INFO success: pretixweb entered RUNNING state, process has stayed up for > than 1 seconds (startsecs)
2020-02-19 20:29:34,889 INFO success: pretixtask entered RUNNING state, process has stayed up for > than 1 seconds (startsecs)
2020-02-19 20:29:34,890 INFO success: nginx entered RUNNING state, process has stayed up for > than 1 seconds (startsecs)
```

Output from `sudo docker exec -it pretix_main pretix upgrade`:
```
Operations to perform:
  Apply all migrations: auth, badges, banktransfer, contenttypes, oauth2_provider, otp_static, otp_totp, paypal, pretixapi, pretixbase, pretixdroid, pretixhelpers, pretixmultidomain, sessions, stripe, ticketoutputpdf
Running migrations:
  No migrations to apply.
INFO 2020-02-19 21:58:10,815 celery.app.trace trace Task pretix.presale.style.regenerate_css[a194dfd8-b424-4093-aa92-06beaa7f08b0] succeeded in 1.1878380769994692s: None
```

What am I doing wrong or how can I debug the problem further? If further information is needed, I will be happy to provide it!

comment.body: I'm not familiar with systemd-tmpfiles, but please make sure it's not accidentally cleaned up, that directory is important ;)
